definition: to fit in with/to suit/appropriate
to cut/to slice/tangent (math)
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]
impractical/not conforming to reality
practical/corresponding to reality/geared to practical situations

sentences.english: This allows the driver to customize the transmission to suit individual track requirements.
sentences.chinese: 这允许司机以自订的传输，以切合个别轨道的要求。

sentences.english: Numerical results showed that the algorithm was efficient and the model was more suitable to the engineering facts.
sentences.chinese: 通过一算例求解结果表明算法可行，模型更切合实际。

sentences.english: He has worked closely with U.S. antiterrorism specialists to train police.
sentences.chinese: 他和美国反恐专家密切合作，对印尼警方进行训练。

sentences.english: "A station type real estate operating service", is different meeds which suit the customer.
sentences.chinese: “一站式地产经营服务”，是切合客户的不同需要。

sentences.english: This suggests people only imply meaning into their dreams when the implications fit their motives.
sentences.chinese: 这表明人们只在意义切合动机时，才将意义暗含梦中。

sentences.english: Fitting in with the Theme"is the first meaning of rhetoric."
Finally, the design should cope with as many situations as practical, and certainly all those normally expected.
sentences.chinese: 最后，设计应当切合实际的各种情况，考虑完整性。

sentences.english: Your plan fell down when it proved too costly.
sentences.chinese: 你的计划是不切合实际的，因为它被证实耗资太大。

sentences.english: Any comparison that is not strictly factual runs the risk of being interpreted as subjective.
sentences.chinese: 任何不完全切合实际的比较都有可能被当作主观臆断。

sentences.english: Thanks to your close cooperation, we succeeded in putting the deal through.
sentences.chinese: 多亏你方的密切合作，我们成功地达成了这笔交易。

sentences.english: Have a realistic exercise work out and take one step at a time.
sentences.chinese: 制定一个切合实际的运动计划并按时逐步实行。

sentences.english: I have worked closely with my own women's mentoring group at The Commonwealth Institute.
sentences.chinese: 我曾与我们女性指导团队在英联邦研究所密切合作过。

sentences.english: One of my jobs is to try to make those more realistic.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作之一是使这些模型更切合实际。

sentences.english: Meet the audience at their level of understanding.
sentences.chinese: 你的演讲应该切合听众的理解能力才好。

sentences.english: In the Dhamma, there is nothing that is impractical or irrational.
sentences.chinese: 佛法中也没有不切合实际或不理性的东西。

sentences.english: They're neither being biblical nor practical in helping that couple.
sentences.chinese: 在帮助他们时，他们既不遵循圣经也不切合实际。

definition: agreement/to agree/to get on with/congenial/agreeing with/to ally oneself with sb
to hit the target (esp. in argument)/to strike home
to accord with/conforming to
to be a good fit/to be identical with/to adjust oneself to/to fit in
gist/main idea/general tenor/one's judgment
to agree implicitly/of one mind/views coincide without a word exchanged
to match/to tally
to be just right for
to go well together/to be compatible/to cater to/to please
to stick closely to (a topic or theme etc)
to cater to/to pander to
(idiom) appropriate/apt/just right
clear/well-defined/limpid
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
practical/corresponding to reality/geared to practical situations
very close/touching/very appropriate
